holidays.name: International Coffee Day ‚òï
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the beloved brew that kickstarts mornings worldwide and fuels countless late nights.
holidays.origin: Started in Japan in 1983 and officially recognized by the International Coffee Organization in 2015 to promote coffee growers and the coffee trade.
holidays.funFact: On International Coffee Day, many cafes offer free or discounted coffee to celebrate the bean!

holidays.name: National Comic Book Day üìö
holidays.description: A celebration of comic books and graphic novels that bring heroes, villains, and fantastic tales to life in colorful panels.
holidays.origin: Originated in the USA to honor the rich history and influence of comic books in pop culture.
holidays.funFact: The first modern comic book is often credited to 'Action Comics #1,' which introduced Superman in 1938.

holidays.name: World Heart Day ‚ù§Ô∏è
holidays.description: An awareness day dedicated to raising awareness about cardiovascular diseases and promoting heart-healthy living worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by the World Heart Federation in 2000 to encourage preventive measures against heart disease.
holidays.funFact: Heart disease is the leading cause of death globally, making this day crucial for spreading life-saving information.

holidays.name: Confucius Day üßß
holidays.description: A day to honor Confucius, the ancient Chinese philosopher known for his teachings on ethics, proper social relationships, and justice.
holidays.origin: Celebrated on Confucius's birthday (traditionally September 28 or 29) mainly in East Asian cultures.
holidays.funFact: Confucius's ideas have influenced education and government in East Asia for over two millennia.
